column1: Glingal was the tree made by Turgon of gold in his royal courts of Gondolin in memory of Laurelin
column2: one of the Two Trees of Valinor. Its mate was Belthil.

column1: Glingal is Sindarin and it means "Hanging Flame".
Robert Foster additionally suggests the translation "gleaming light".
In earlier versions of the tales
column3: Glingol) was a name of Laurelin.
